page.title: 03AROUND SHERINGHAM.
page.content: Around Sheringham are various interesting features both{natural and {historical.}To the East is Beeston "Bump" which has an Ordnance Survey triangulation point on the top. The beach at West Runton is of interest for the{fossils}which can be found. At Beeston Regis, the parish adjacent to Sheringham, are the remains of an Augustinian Priory.{ Archaeologists have recently held a dig here. {The National Trust}own much of Beeston Regis Heath and the area to the south of West Runton known as The Roman Camp. The hills around Sheringham are made up of{deposits}left by the last {Ice Age}and it is the hilliest part of Norfolk. Areas such as Pretty Corner in Sheringham, Stone Hill at Beeston Regis and Beacon Hill at West Runton make the{hilly scenery}very attractive for residents and visitors.
